New Records: Freddie Freeman tied a World Series record with 12 runs batted in
Key Match Events: The Dodgers stormed to a 7-6 victory at Yankee Stadium in Game 5 of the World Series
Gerrit Cole's need for six outs to escape the fifth inning led to the Dodgers scoring five runs, tying the score at 5-5
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning to bring in the winning run
Walker Buehler finished off the Yankees with his first career save, fanning Alex Verdugo for the final out
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
The Dodgers' handling of Game 4 was not illogical in a vacuum, with a 3-0 lead series lead and top relievers having been used heavily
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The Dodgers' relentlessness paid off, as they wore down the Yankees' pitching staff and created cracks to slip through
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the Dodgers' eighth championship in franchise history and first since 2020
This was the second time in postseason history that a team blew a five-plus run lead with all of the runs being unearned
The Dodgers will finally get their parade after winning the World Series
Others: The Yankees' inability to generate swing-and-miss allowed the Dodgers to cash in on their opportunities
The Dodgers' bullpen game in Game 4 had a clear downside, as they were unable to pivot to their top relief arms
